intro: Epidendrum hemisclerioides, commonly known as the Emerald Gem, is a terrestrial orchid native to Central and South America. It features a sympodial growth habit with a rhizome that produces multiple pseudobulbs. The plant has lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale green flowers with a distinctive, elongated spur. This species thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
